revised_title: Experimental Study of Unstable Oscillation of Tubular Cantilevers Conveying Fluid
tldr: This article presents experiments conducted on rubber and metal tubes conveying fluid to study their unstable oscillation and stability conditions. The experiments aimed to check the theoretical predictions of the behavior and conditions of stability associated with unstable oscillation of tubular cantilevers conveying fluid. The results showed that damping may destabilize the system, and the observations agreed with the theoretical predictions. The study provides insights into the non-linear behavior of these systems and their structural stability.
